"I think Elon Musk‚Äôs judgment started to worsen sometime around 2020. He was always mercurial, somewhat impulsive, prone to setting unrealistic timelines, and at times needlessly combative. However, I held hope that his positive qualities, which helped lead Tesla and SpaceX to tremendous success, would win out and he would reign in his worst tendencies. Sadly, the opposite happened, and now I no longer trust his leadership of Tesla."https://strangecosmos.substack.com/p/self-driving-cars-arent-nearly-a?triedRedirect=trueVia #MarginalRevolution #TSLA

@pluralistic The best description of the market I‚Äôve heard is that it‚Äôs a self licking ice cream cone. Decades ago it was based on rational fundamentals, but with high frequency trading it really is just a popularity contest sniffing its own farts. A decade with #tsla was elucidating We don‚Äôt get #enshitification to this extent without the #mbas and #lawyers We need more builders and less takers. Teach the kids to be creators, not consumers

Another cycle, another lie exposed. Doubts aren‚Äôt doubts anymore, they‚Äôre facts. I love their EVs, but ditch #TSLA.

Norway wealth fund to vote against Musk's $1 trillion Tesla pay packageNorway's sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, said on Tuesday it would vote against ratifying Tesla CEO Elon Musk's proposed compensation package, containing shares worth up to $1 trillion, at an annual general meeting this week.https://finance.yahoo.com/news/norway-wealth-fund-vote-against-064600149.html#Tesla #TSLA #ElonMusk

Record #Tesla revenue in Q3 in USA (as $7500 tax credit expired) and almost record revenue in "Other" (rest of the world) outside China which didn't do too badly either.  Q4 revenue likely to be way down in the USA.  Very unlikely that China & Other can take up the slack. #TSLA

I don‚Äôt give a toss about some techbro getting fucked over by another techbro‚Äôs company, but this is fucking hilarious.Especially considering Elon believes his leadership is worth $1T.‚ÄúPlenty of other electric automakers have introduced electric hypercars in the eight years since Musk declared the second Roadster a thing, with no sign of it being any closer to reality, if the latest job postings are accurate. And it seems that over time, a lot of the people who gave the company a hefty deposit‚Äîsome say interest-free loan‚Äîhave become tired of waiting and want their money back.And that‚Äôs not quite so easy, it turns out. Musk‚Äôs current Silicon Valley rival is the latest to discover this. According to Sam Altman‚Äôs social media account, he placed an order for a Roadster on July 11, 2018, with a deposit of $45,000 ($58,206 in today‚Äôs money). But after emailing Tesla for a refund, he discovered the email address associated with preorders had been deleted.‚Äù#TeslaRoadster #TSLA https://arstechnica.com/cars/2025/10/sam-altman-wants-a-refund-for-his-50000-tesla-roadster-deposit/

Exactly!
In Dec 2024 Musk owned 410.79 million tesla shares, let's round that down to 400M.
By buying shares for USD 1B his existing shares gained a value of USD 30 per share.
That is 30 x 400M = over USD 12B. 
He may use that 12B as a collateral for a bank loan to cover the purchase of these new shares. 
So the shares are practically free for him.Money makes money.#tesla #TSLA  #musk #limitarianism #limitarisme #EatTheRich
#TSLA wasn't worth $350/share last week, and it's not worth $420 this week.
Bouncing on key level #TSLA

Musk now owns about 13% of Tesla. When the CEO is buying with his own cash, that usually means he sees something good coming.The timing isn't random. Tesla's been beaten down this year but gained 60% over the past six months. Volume surge after his purchase shows retail investors are paying attention.Actions speak louder than words. And $1 billion is pretty loud.#Tesla #TSLA #ElonMusk #StockMarket (2/2)
